meanings.definition: causing slight but persistent annoyance or discomfort
meanings.sent1: The niggly pebble in my shoe bothered me all day.
meanings.sent2: Her niggly habit of tapping her pen distracted the class.
meanings.sent3: The niggly fly kept buzzing around my head during the picnic.
meanings.sent4: The niggly sound of dripping water echoed in the empty cave.
meanings.sent5: The niggly itch on my arm wouldn't go away no matter how much I scratched.

meanings.definition: characterized by minor irritations or annoyances
meanings.sent1: The niggly details in the contract caused delays in signing.
meanings.sent2: His niggly behavior made it hard to enjoy the party.
meanings.sent3: The niggly knot in her necklace made it impossible to untangle.
meanings.sent4: The niggly traffic jam seemed to stretch on forever.
meanings.sent5: The niggly stain on the carpet refused to come out despite many attempts.

meanings.definition: to feel or express slight annoyance or discomfort
meanings.sent1: I niggly complained about the uncomfortable chair.
meanings.sent2: She niggly grumbled about the long wait at the doctor's office.
meanings.sent3: He niggly muttered about the rainy weather ruining his plans.
meanings.sent4: The child niggly whined about having to eat his vegetables.
meanings.sent5: They niggly griped about the slow internet connection in the cafe.
